entry.title: Git and Github
entry.content:
Today we learned about Git and Github. Git is a distributed revision system that keeps track of changes made to your files on your local machine. Github keeps track of the files on the github.com site. It allows you to keep a copy of your files on the web server so that other users can view and download them.

The basic git commands are… git init – initializes the current directory as a git directory. git status – displays the status of the files in that directory as far as whetrher they have been added or committed to git. git add FILENAME – adds the file to the staging area. git commit -m “example message” – commits the added files. git remote add origin – creates a new remote called origin. git push -u origin master – actually pushes the file to Github.

Now that the files are in github, other users can view and download those files for their own use. Github is a way for other developers on a development team to share each others files for a project.

entry.title: Ruby on Rails Class
entry.content: Last night was my first Ruby on Rails class. We learned about settupe up Octopress and using Rubymine to create this neat little blog. The class will keep us very busy with lots of homework ! Currently, our homework assignments consist of going through an online Ruby tutorial. Stay tuned for further updates….
